column1: #Text=[0280] As the off-gas of the membrane separation reformer (line C103), there is obtained a mixed gas having a total gas flow rate excluding steam of 23.9 kmol/h, a CO.sub.2 concentration of 51%, a CO concentration of 5.8%, and a hydrogen concentration of 34%.
#Text=This mixed gas further passes through the shift reactor C3 packed with a Cu--Zn-based catalyst and operated at an outlet temperature of 300.degree.
#Text=C. and is thereby converted into a mixed gas having a CO.sub.2 concentration of 54%, a CO concentration of 0.9%, and a hydrogen concentration of 37% (line C104).

#Text=The resulting mixed gas is dewatered with a dewaterer (not shown) and then introduced into the hydrogen separation membrane C4 provided with a polyimide membrane having a CO.sub.2/hydrogen permeability coefficient ratio .alpha. of 0.11.

#Text=On the permeation side of the hydrogen separation membrane, there is obtained 3.7 kmol/h of a gas (line C105) having a hydrogen concentration of 80% and a pressure of 0.1 MPa, which is recycled upstream of the membrane separation reformer C1 through the compressor C7 and the line C106.

#Text=[0281] On the other hand, the non-permeation side gas (line C107) of the hydrogen separation membrane is introduced, at a pressure as it is, into the CO.sub.2 separation membrane C5 including a membrane having a CO.sub.2/hydrogen permeability coefficient ratio .alpha. of 30.

#Text=The permeation side gas (line C108) of the CO.sub.2 separation membrane has a CO.sub.2 concentration of 95%, which is pressurized to about 8 MPa by the compressor C8 and then fed into the CO.sub.2 liquefier C6 from the line C109 to yield 9.0 kmol/h of a liquefied CO.sub.2 flow (line C110).

#Text=The non-permeation side gas (line C111) of the CO.sub.2 separation membrane and the off-gas of the CO.sub.2 liquefier (line C112) are combined to form a gas flow (line C113), which is sent to the reformer burner 1e, used as a fuel for combustion in the reformer, and then discharged (line C122).

#Text=[0282] The energy consumed by the compressors in this process is 5.7 kW/kmol-recovered CO.sub.2, and the carbon dioxide recovery rate as liquefied CO.sub.2 based on the amount of CO.sub.2 contained in the membrane separation reformer outlet gas (line C103) is 74%.

#Text=[0283] The permeability coefficient ratio .alpha. of the carbon dioxide separation membrane, the amount of high purity hydrogen recovered, the amount of carbon dioxide recovered, and the energy consumption (sum total) of the compressors per 1 kmol of the recovered liquefied carbon dioxide are shown in Table C1.
#Text=The heat and mass balance is shown in Table C5.
